title: How to Make Painted Wooden Bowls

steps.headline: Visualize your design before you paint.
steps.description: You will use the painter’s tape to create cool geometric designs and shapes so have some idea before you begin to work.

steps.headline: Cut tape and place on the bowl.
steps.description: This may mean doubling up to create wide borders or cutting the tape for something narrower. Carefully apply tape to the bowl, making sure you have no bubbles or wrinkles. Smooth over tape with your fingers.

steps.headline: Sand the bowl (lightly) to integrate the tape into the wood.
steps.description: The tape will still peel off easily when you are finished painting, but the sanding will help the tape adhere better to the bowl. Brush any debris away before painting.

steps.headline: Paint bowl.
steps.description: Use smooth, long strokes and allow paint to dry. You may need to add several coats of paint to completely cover each area. This may depend on the color and hue you are using.

steps.headline: Remove tape when paint is completely dry.
steps.description: Peel slowly and carefully so you don’t leave tape behind or pull up the paint.
